result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Thoreson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
JOC amended 05-17-2019: It is Ordered the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office Staff and will be based upon actual release date.
IT IS Furthered Ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Consecutive to: 15CF32

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $1,630.50.   Cash bond applied.  If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Cognitive Behavior Class as directed by DOC agent.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.    As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.
Defendant to submit to random UA's and drug testing. Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Daniel Lee Thoreson in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Frederick Ian Bourg and Amber Hahn (AAG) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Snyder informs the Court that his client is waiving PH.  Court finds that Mr. Thoreson is K&V waiving his right to PH.  Court reviews complaint; finds probable cause and defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  DA files information with the Court; Atty Snyder indicates he has rec'd a copy, waives reading; Client understands charges and consequences.  Enters a plea of NG.  Court continues bond as ordered.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

his bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.    We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part.    Defendant is to complete a Risk/Needs Assessment and set up TAD monitoring before being released.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.    Defendant will be subject to random and scheduled monitoring by TAD officer, and will meet with the TAD specialist as required.  Subject to random checks and searches by TAD specialist or designee.  Advise TAD specialist with any change of address.  Defendant is not to enter into any business whose primary source of income is from the sale of intoxicating beverages.
